This low-cost laptop might run on an iPhone chip and help Apple convince more people to switch from Windows machines. Could playful colors — and possibly a plastic case — make this low-end Apple laptop a hit? This week’s top Apple news: Apple’s cheapest laptop ever and more

On the show this week: Your host Leander Kahney (@lkahney), Cult of Mac managing editor Lewis Wallace (@lewiswallace) and Cult of Mac writer D. Griffin Jones (@dgriffinjones).

Here are the headlines we’re talking about on this week’s show:

  • Apple might launch its most affordable MacBook yet next year
  • Apple could rely on AI rivals to make Siri smarter
  • Lighter, cheaper Vision Air could rescue Apple’s headset dream
  • These are the best and coolest Apple Watch faces
  • Long live Apple’s late, great iPod Hi-Fi stereo [Setups]

Under Review

Leander goes over the pros (tons of ’em!) and cons (not many!) of three after-market CarPlay displays. They come in several sizes and form factors, but all provide an inexpensive way to add CarPlay to your ride.

  • 10-inch Touchscreen Wireless Car Display with GPS, CarPlay and Android Auto — high-def 1,024-by-60 touchscreen runs on Android 12 and supports backup camera (not included) and Wi-Fi for app downloading.
  • 7-inch Wireless Car Display with CarPlay, Android Auto and Phone Mirroring — smaller screen comes with convenient suction cup bracket and stick-on base to give you more mounting options.
  • 6.8-inch Foldable Touchscreen Car Display with CarPlay Android Auto — folding design makes it great for stashing in your glove box. Plus, it comes with a built-in FM transmitter for an easy audio connection and support for a rear-view camera.
